info.name: Lateral lemniscus, nucleus
info.description: The lateral lemniscus is the ascending auditory pathway.  It originates primarily in the cochlear nuclei and terminates in the nuclei of the inferior colliculus.  Along the length of the lateral lemniscus, there are occasional small groups of neurons that constitute additional synapses in the auditory pathway.  These small groups of neurons are referred to as the nuclei of the lateral lemniscus.
